overview:
Parker Reilly is the co-founder of House Party, and today runs its Media Group, which leverages consumer-generated media as powerful vehicles for buzz.

Parker is a pioneer in creating visionary solutions that help brands connect with consumers.

In 1993, Parker broke new ground by marrying the emerging power of the internet with the unquestioned power of word-of-mouth. His work on behalf of PolyGram Records led to the creation of BARK, a network of opinion-leading teens that gathered online and held listening parties in their homes — the genesis of the House Party concept.

Later, for MTV Networks, Parker created Natalie’s Backseat Traveling Web Show — one of the earliest web shows, and the first to interweave TV and web-based storylines.

Then, for Teen People magazine, Parker created the Trendspotters, a network of teen alpha-readers that collaborated with its editor and publisher on content and marketing.

In 2001, Parker created one of the first commercial blogs, Secret Goldfish, to bring together media giant Primedia’s wide-ranging teen media properties.

A working musician with a gold record in his past, Parker earned his B.A. at Harvard. He has two children and lives in Irvington, NY.
